thread.title: Seahawks sign old friend Blair Walsh to attempt to kick field goals
thread.title_full: Seahawks sign old friend Blair Walsh to attempt to kick field goals

author: Brandon Schlager (bschlager@sportingnews.com)
title: Seahawks sign old friend Blair Walsh to attempt to kick field goals
text:
NFL February 9, 2017 5:17pm EST February 9, 2017 5:10pm EST American Football, News, English, Blair Walsh, NFL, Minnesota Vikings, Seattle Seahawks The former Viking's career hasn't been the same since his now-infamous missed chip shot that gave the Seahawks a playoff victory in 2016. Blair Walsh (Getty Images) 
Updated at 5:17 p.m. ET 
Updated at 5:17 p.m. ET 
Blair Walsh's kicking career hasn't been the same since his now-infamous missed chip shot in a 2016 playoff game cost the Vikings their season. 
But Walsh has been given a chance at redemption by the biggest beneficiary of his flub, the Seahawks, who signed the free-agent kicker Thursday to replace free-agent-to-be Steven Hauschka, the team announced . 
MORE: NFL Mock Draft 2017 
The Vikings were a 27-yard field goal attempt away from defeating the Seahawks in their wild-card round meeting a year ago, but Walsh's kick sailed wide left with 22 seconds remaining. NFL kickers had hit 189 of 191 field goals from 27 yards or shorter during the 2015 season. 
Ever since, Walsh hasn't been able to snap out of a funk. He missed four field goals and four extra points in eight games last season before Minnesota cut him. 
In a twist, he'll be in line to replace Hauschka, who has been one of the NFL's more accurate kickers since joining the Seahawks in 2011. 
Walsh, entering his fifth season, made the Pro Bowl as a rookie in 2012 after setting an NFL record by going 10-for-10 on attempts of 50 yards or more. He still maintains an 84.2 field goal percentage through his career. Watch This
